lexUnit.name: canter.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: move at the pace of a horse between a trot and a gallop

sentence.text: Such bad habits include the horse refusing to stand still while someone is trying to mount it , or the horse cantering on only one lead .
The horses were free in the courtyard now , cantering about in terror whilst Ivrigar 's people tried to control them .
You will be asked to walk , trot and canter around the ring with the other horses .
And when you tire of that , how about hiring a mountain bike and cycling through real mountains , or for the more traditional , cantering out through meadows and forest on horse-back .
Horses love to canter up hills : they want to see what is beyond .
From time to time , horses and riders would canter past .
Hermes cantered slowly but Tessa , Nora 's filly , was close to a gallop .
The Springfield playing fields have been ploughed up by cars driving on them , horses cantering and people playing golf .
From walk , they progressed to canter .
At the end of that week , Grégoire was allowed to canter .
Mabs picked up her reins , pulled her horse 's head up and said , ` Shall we canter up to the top ? "
He clasped me once more by the wrist and , turning his horse , cantered quickly out of sight .
` Impressive , is n't it ? " observed a voice by Rincewind 's knee as the horse cantered through the haze of decaying timber and falling leaves .
Our horses plunged down from the hard road , cantered heavily through a league of wet meadow-land , and gained the fast going of the road that led south-west .
